comments:
I'm using the 1.0M2 version of Webtools with the versions of Eclipse drive, EMF,
GEF and JEM suggested here
http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/S-1.0M2-200412230036/index.html

Problem
---

I have some SVG (*.svg) and XSLFO (*.fo or *.xslfo) files in my project.  I
assigned the XML Source Page Editor to be the default editor of these file
extensions in the File Associations page(*see note at end).  When opening one of
these files (cd.svg) with that editor I get the following error:

"Cannot open default editor on cd.svg. Editor could not be initialised"

Opening the Error Log view I see the following error:

"Error 2005-01-04 13:44:32.778 assertion failed: Editing document must be an
IStructuredDocument

An exception stack trace could not be found.

eclipse.buildId=I20041216-2000
java.version=1.4.2_05
java.vendor=Apple Computer, Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=macosx, ARCH=ppc, WS=carbon, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -keyring /Users/murraysteele/.eclipse_keyring -showlocation
Command-line arguments:  -os macosx -ws carbon -arch ppc -keyring
/Users/murraysteele/.eclipse_keyring -consoleLog -showlocation"
 
Workaround
---
However, when I rename the files to have a .xml file extension (e.g. cd.svg.xml)
it opens correctly in the XML Source Page Editor and I am able to edit them. 

XML Editor Error
---
Note that the same problem exists (albeit with different errors, see below) if I
try to use the property-sheet-style XML Editor to edit these files (again with
the same resolution that I can rename the files to .xml to get it to work). 

Dialog = "Unable to create part"

Note that this ends up opening an empty tab in the editor window.


Footnote:
--
* When assiging the editor to the file extensions there were two XML Source Page
Editor choices; I used the first.  I assume this is some ui bug that two editors
are available as when it didn't work I then went back and changed the editor to
the second option, but this had no effect.

Bug 81829 covers there being two XML Source editors; I'm unable to mark this as
a duplicate of more than one bug.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 78340 ***

Marking as verified as I know this issue is fixed (or correctly categorized).
If, as originator, you disagree or still see, please re-open, or open a new bug. 

Thanks very much for reporting and helping make WTP better.

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP defects already verified by the reporter but awaiting closure by the assignee.  If you feel this defect was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
